summary:
[Note: Many of the activities mentioned in this profile should be taken as equally applicable to my wife Mieke Groot, who has been participating in all and everything from the start.]

My original background was in physics and classics, which led to one thing and another. Our main subjects are rooted in a long tradition – see the History paragraph of the Experience section. At present we’re mainly occupied with exploring and developing pure scientific and applicable knowledge and insights in the fields of vision as a behaviour, and of vision-based behaviour. The expertise gained is particularly useful in the visual ergonomics of road traffic, e.g. in the analysis of accepted traffic policies and specific traffic situations.

As of 2012 we’re part of the co-operation Verkeer-Zien, with Max van Kelegom of VMC (cf. www.verkeerzien.nl). In this co-operation we’re involved in the critical review of often shakily founded and sometimes even counterproductive habits of policy and design in road traffic. Regrettably such shortcomings are often shown by local, regional and national authorities, as well as by institutes, consultancies, and others claiming authority and competence. A case in point is how regional and bicycle traffic are treated – see Post 1.
In that context we try to offer rational alternatives, as by advising on actual traffic situations, mainly road sections. Such advice is based on our own independent on-site research. My personal interests are:
empirical psychophysics of visual perception, empirical cognitive science of perception, theoretical
cognitive science, visual foundations of traffic behaviour, empirical psychophysics of visual art,
philosophy of mind and consciousness...

For further information, see the paragraphs ‘History’ and ‘Present’ in the Experience section and the Posts on this profile.

profile_positions.description:
History
Our activities started in the late 70’s of the 20th century, when we were known as IWACC, a name we still may use to show our historical roots. At the time, the main part of our work involved visual research for traffic-related industries and public or government institutions. This ended in the late 80’s, when for nearly 25 years I remained out of circulation by an intractable health problem. For those interested, details of that history can be found in the appendix of “Drawbacks of the emphasis on conspicuousness for the natural coherence of the perceived traffic scene, revisited” (the relevant PDF is accessible through http://www.verkeerzien.nl/drawbacks/index.html).
In the intervening period (1989–2012) I kept up with science by reading and comparing material from a growing and widening collection of fields. I followed a rather unusual course along widely separated connections: from Anaxagoras to Francis Crick, from Maupertuis to Feynman, from Santiago Ramón y Cajal to Bennet etc. On the practical side I gained a lot of hands-on experience with visual techniques and their apparent effects.
(Apart from this, I joined my wife in translating books as a source of income. Visual art was something else, but that is a different subject altogether.)

Present
See the Summary section for an overview of our activities. Our website www.verkeerzien.nl offers a few examples, as e.g. the two parts of “Babel or babble”. However, much of the present work doesn’t result in an official publication, and most of the work from the early period (see the History section of the Summary) that *has* been published was never digitized.
